content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Equifax can't even oust its hapless chairman and chief executive effectively. Rick Smith is "retiring " as the corporate euphemism goes  after failing to prevent a massive cyber attack and fumbling the response - and with little financial penalty to boot. An interim management plan makes clear the board hadn't planned succession adequately either. Equifax needs regime change at every level.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Breakingviews - Equifax can't even oust its failed CEO effectively

title: UPDATE 1-Canadian privacy commissioner launches probe of Equifax breach

content: NEW YORK Wall Street edged up to a record high on Wednesday as gains in consumer discretionary and energy stocks offset losses in technology heavyweight Apple Inc. | Video
name: Equifax Inc
title: Wall Street hits record high - without help from Apple

content: Sept 8 Equifax Inc faced a storm of criticism on Friday over a hack that may have compromised personal data for some 143 million Americans  with consumers clamoring for answers and cyber security experts questioning the response to the massive breach.
name: Equifax Inc
title: UPDATE 8-Criticism of Equifax data breach response mounts  shares tumble

content: Sept 11 More than two dozen lawsuits have been filed in the United States against Equifax Inc after the credit reporting company said thieves may have stolen personal information for 143 million Americans in one of the largest hackings ever.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Lawsuits against Equifax pile up

content: WASHINGTON  Sept 15 Connecticut's attorney general  and others investigating Equifax Inc's data breach  which affected some 143 million people  asked the company on Friday to disable links to collect fees for credit monitoring.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Connecticut attorney general  others ask Equifax to stop collecting fees

content: WASHINGTON  Sept 13 Rhode Island said on Wednesday that it had joined a group of states probing the Equifax data breach  as the credit company's shares fell another 14 percent amid growing pressure to explain its handling of the hack.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Rhode Island joins U.S. states investigating Equifax data breach

content: Equifax Inc faced a storm of criticism on Friday over a hack that may have compromised personal data for some 143 million Americans  with consumers clamoring for answers and cyber security experts questioning the response to the massive breach.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Criticism of Equifax data breach response mounts  shares tumble

content: Equifax Inc  a provider of consumer credit scores  said personal details of as many as 143 million U.S. consumers were accessed by hackers between mid-May and July  in what could be one of the largest data breaches in the United States.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Equifax says hack potentially exposed details of 143 mln consumers

content: Sept 12 Massachusetts attorney general announces her intention to sue equifax following recent security breach -- statement HEALEY SAYS SHE INTENDS TO ALLEGE THAT EQUIFAX LACKED APPROPRIATE SAFEGUARDS TO PROTECT CONSUMER DATA  VIOLATING STATE LAW STATE ATTORNEY GENERAL MAURA HEALEY SAYS LAWSUIT WOULD CONCERN EQUIFAX'S FAILURE TO PROTECT PERSONAL INFORMATION OF AS MANY AS NEARLY 3 MILLION MASSACHUSETTS RESIDENTS
name: Equifax Inc
title: BRIEF-Massachusetts intends to sue Equifax over security breach

content: Shareholders haven’t had much success in securities class actions blaming investor losses on corporate data breach disclosures.

title: Will Equifax securities class action break jinx for shareholders?

name: Equifax Inc

content: WASHINGTON Thirty-six U.S. senators on Tuesday called on federal authorities to investigate the sale of nearly $2 million in shares of credit bureau Equifax Inc  by company executives after a massive data breach  and one compared their actions to insider trading.
name: Equifax Inc
title: U.S. senator on Equifax hack: 'Somebody needs to go to jail'

content: WASHINGTON Two key U.S. senators on Monday asked Equifax Inc  to answer detailed questions about a breach of information affecting up to 143 million Americans  including whether U.S. government agency records were compromised in the hack.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Key U.S. senators demand answers on Equifax hacking

content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - When Americans are hacked  they turn to three big consumer-credit agencies for help with identity theft. What happens when one of them  Equifax  is hit by hackers who steal sensitive personal information on 143 million people?
name: Equifax Inc
title: Breakingviews - Equifax hack provides an Exxon Valdez moment

content: NEW YORK  Sept 8 Less than a day after Equifax revealed one of the biggest data breaches in U.S. corporate history  the credit reporting company has already been hit with two proposed class actions in federal court – and one of those cases was filed by consumer lawyers who just won the right to move forward with gargantuan data breach litigation against Yahoo.
name: Equifax Inc
title: COLUMN-Equifax data breach liability could hinge on where case is tried: Frankel

content: Less than a day after Equifax revealed one of the biggest data breaches in U.S. corporate history  the credit reporting company has already been hit with two proposed class actions in federal court – and one of those cases was filed by consumer lawyers who just won the right to move forward with gargantuan data breach litigation against Yahoo.
name: Equifax Inc
title: Equifax data breach liability could hinge on where case is tried

content: SYDNEY  Oct 6 U.S. credit agency Equifax Inc  sweetened its takeover offer for rival Veda Group Ltd  on Tuesday  winning the Australian target's approval  as the weak Aussie dollar and stumbling share market fuel a frenzy of inbound M&A deals.
name: Equifax Inc
title: U.S.-based Equifax sweetens $1.6 bln tilt at Australian rival Veda
